text: Hi! Thank you. Actually after reading the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/crm-extensions/crm-extensions-overview> all becomes much more clear to me
Anyway, I would like to do basically the same thing as it is shown in the example. To have a list of custom entities taken from external source and showing it for a Company in HubSpot

It is clear to me now how to fetch the data. What is not really clean to me is how to create a new custom entity frorm HubSpot. Or basically, providing an action which requires user input. It seems to me I have to use the IFORM action. Does that mean I have to actually implement GUI on my web server, which will be just shown in HubSpot? Or is it possible to somehow define the data form, which HubSpot could interpret into a GUI? Something like confirmation hook action, but with custom data which would be then send to my web server. I would like to avoid creating my own GUI since I have no experience with frontend.

<@U0105HL3CSU> you can handle that all using the apis, you can either manually create all the company custom fields <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/companies/create_company_property> , or can create via api, then to create/update an company with those fields, and you can update the company too - <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/companies/update_company>

so no need of GUI at all, the IFORM action is for CRM extension api, in case if you want to create an extension like this -<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/crm-extensions/crm-extensions-overview>
No, I believe what I need is exactly the extension. There can
the company can have multiple of these entities, and I need to make it possible for the user to create a new one from HubSpot
oh in that case then yes, you need the extension and the GUI too
hi! are pop up form buttons open in a new tab by default? is there a way to control that?
